Description of Oliviavante


The street Old Street comes to an abrupt end, terminating in The Town Square


The street Daraln Close comes to an abrupt end, terminating in The Markets of Oliviavante


In the centre of the town is the road Smith Plaza, and nearby is The Dragon and Woman


Swiftwhistle Alley is a relatively shady looking alleyway, which houses The Oliviavante Docks


Further towards the centre of Oliviavante is the road King Way. Along it is The Sweet Tray


Also on King Way is St. Lavinia's Churchyard

The road Common Road comes to an abrupt end, terminating in The Oliviavante Clothing Shop

Further towards the centre of Oliviavante is the street Baker Row. Nearby is Carric's Hairdresser

town:
The Town of Oliviavante

Oliviavante is a town located on the polar river coast, where the vegetation is desolate. Oliviavante grew around a calm, coastal bay, and is comprised . They are a patriarchal primitivist autocratic absolute monarchy that .

The nearest is a weathered treestump about the height of a man. Dozens of age-tarnished coins have been hammered into one side of the stump. A population of 5800, the denizens live a modest existence. A procession of ghosts is currently taking place.

Government in Oliviavante

The people of Oliviavante work the land in a loosely organised sense; there is no concept of ownership, and the majority of the town's citizens are hunter-gatherers. Ms Ielenia Lathalas is the supreme ruler, and all laws and affairs are governed by the crown's will.

Economics

Trade in Oliviavante is regulated, with taxes and restrictions on what can be brought in and out of the town, and people live a modest existence because of it. The trade guild enforces rules, with stiff penalties and trade bans for rule-breakers. Welfare is bad. Citizens can expect the bare minimum of death services. Healthcare and education are fringe cases, and citizens would do better to seek a private benefactor than try and receive treatment from the government.

Law and Order

The policing presence in Oliviavante is a militia; most of the guards of The Peacemen of Club are part time, and there is little need for the use of force. Citizens act with honesty, and have no need for 24/7 guards. Law in Oliviavante is punitive based, and those that breach the laws can expect hard labor, incarceration, fines, or, in some instances, public execution. Crime is an ugly stain on humanity, to be removed wherever possible. Magic is not codified into the laws as anything specific, though the local guards would be more likely to treat it as a threat rather than not.

0808cf38-37be-4bf0-b26d-0f86f2d27320.name: The Town Square
0808cf38-37be-4bf0-b26d-0f86f2d27320.output:
You're in the town square. It's rather packed, and relatively tidy. It features an ornate fountain that several children are playing in. As you enter the town square, you see a youthful adult halfling toss a coin to a beggar.
There's a old woman with a jaw narrowed into a pointed little chin who calls out to you, and says "You look lost. Do you know your way around the city? I can guide you, for just 5 Silver".

She will lead the players down an alley where her compatriots will attempt to rob the players.
There's also a noticeboard, which has various posters, requests, and announcements tacked to it.

08fe309c-032f-4fda-92b8-0f3033badb3f.name: The Markets of Oliviavante
08fe309c-032f-4fda-92b8-0f3033badb3f.output:
You wander through the streets of Oliviavante, and come across the market, which is located in a huge pavilion with a solid roof overhead. It seems that the vendors are organised by whoever got to what spot first. The market is known for the wonderful scents and colors of the merchandise, and is riddled with the refuse of merchant horses and other livestock. Today the market is decently busy, and several people are going between shops examining all the different merchandise.


Merchants

Off to the side, a rather short human is beckoning "Sledges for sale! Going fast! Only a moron would ignore these low prices!" from a myriad of pockets in the vendor's clothes.

Nearby, a taller than average man with a flabby face is selling swords and spears from a racks of goods set up in a circle.

Nearby, a adorably short woman with very hairy forearms is shouting out "Muffins! Fresh muffins! Cinnamon and clove! This bargain can't be beat!" from a permanent stone stall.

A quite diminutive female halfling is calling "Pirelli's Miracle Elixir! For all your hair problems! Be the envy of your friends!" from a one- or two-man tent.

60399e50-b880-47d2-8b21-0871962b4d4a.name: The Dragon and Woman
60399e50-b880-47d2-8b21-0871962b4d4a.output:
You make your way through the town of Oliviavante until you come to a pub, which is called The Dragon and Woman, a large shabby cobblestone pub with a yellow tiled roof that the locals know best for its clean beds.</p>

The Tavern

The Dragon and Woman is a large building, with the absolutely spotless bar occupying the ground floor, and the beds for patrons are on the floor directly above you. It's poorly lit. A small cat is slowly weaving between the legs of patrons.
You can barely hear each other over the din of the other patrons, who are pretty rowdy. One elbows you in the ribs as they try to get around you to the bar.


Who else is here?



The Bar

Behind the counter is who you would assume to be the bartender, a prime adult aged halfling who is currently scratching herbuttocks. You walk up to the bar, and strike up conversation with the woman, who introduces herself as Saral Sunmeadow, the manager of The Dragon and Woman.

Saral Sunmeadow


Saral Sunmeadow looks bemused, but seems pleased with the welcome distraction from the patrons, who she tells you are for the most part a seedy lot. Saral pours herself a drink while you talk with the scrawny woman about the regular goings on in Oliviavante, and The Dragon and Woman, and Saral says "We're lucky that I bought that extra case of grog... I get the feeling that we're gonna need it."</p>


On offer today... Saral says that they have some freshly brewed ale, although you soon discover that to be a lie; it's lukewarm, and barely carbonated.

Hyperborean Cider

The special brew of the week is a Bottled Sunshine called Hyperborean Cider, selling for 4 Silver 6 Copper. Fermented with juice made from apples collected from the Celestial Plane. Gloriously, radiantly golden, no head, ever, and never sours. Sweet and warm, with hints of clove, cinnamon, and sunrises. You can still get a hangover, don’t believe that myth, and there are few things in the multiverse worse than being hungover on the Celestial Plane. Everyone is singing and everything IS SO VERY BRIGHT.
The house cheese is 2 Silver 1 Copper and is a pale grey, with dark flecks cheese which is mildly grainy. It smells like the best parts of a farm's stable, and tastes inoffensively mild.

Tavern Entertainment

A clever looking half-orc is currently up on the dingy looking stage reading their poetry to a drunken crowd.

Two-Up

A small crowd of people are gathered around a table, where two people flip two coins in the air, with one old woman with large, wide feet groaning whenever they both turned heads, and another old elf greedily grabbing the coins from the man in charge of overseeing the bets whenever they both turn tails, flicking the overseer a copper for his troubles.
The diminutive female gnome that was playing says "Two coins are flipped by the 'spinner', who bets against another. Both heads wins, both tails loses, and one of each calls for another cointoss, with the 'spinner' losing out on five consecutive re-tosses. The current bet is 6 Copper."

Interesting things in The Dragon and Woman...

You see a noticeboard next to the pub's cobblestone bar. Walking over to it, you see a number of barter requests nailed to the noticeboard; simple things like 'need help with rat problems'.

acccd839-5fb1-4a46-8eaa-9038ab5f6f5d.name: The  Oliviavante Docks
acccd839-5fb1-4a46-8eaa-9038ab5f6f5d.output:
You walk down to the docks, which are known best for the time the local the local militia and fishermen held back a pirate raid on the town here. You notice a small group of men posing for a portrait with the carcass of an enormous sea monster strung up from a tall wooden pole.

The docks are huge; it sprawls across the body of water, as far as the eye can see, and is disgusting. All types of moulds, algae, and other unspeakably slimy things are on display here.. It's currently reasonably busy, with a couple folks milling about, waiting for a ship to dock.

c0f54683-36e3-4255-a933-307fdcb9b652.output:
You come inside a shabby daub bakeshop with a decently built white shingled roof called The Sweet Tray. You notice a large millstone behind the shop counter.

This bakeshop is known for putting delicious spices in their bread dough. There is a short-ish woman currently blending together a bowl of ingredients. She welcomes you, and asks what you are after.

35a1cb45-843d-440f-a6f2-6893a653e6fd.name: St. Lavinia's Churchyard
35a1cb45-843d-440f-a6f2-6893a653e6fd.output:
You walk down King Way to the churchyard. It is located near the center of town, and is fairly large, with some very ornate looking tombstones. You enter the churchyard through a large archway carved out of an enormous aspen tree. It's mostly nearly forgotten, with many headstones having fallen over or crumbled away. As you enter you notice at the far end of the churchyard is a well kempt shrine to a popular god.


Gravedigger

A gravedigger is leaning against a nearby tree while smoking a pipe.
The gravedigger greets you as you come near, and introduces herself as Verna Smoothhands. She says to watch out for ghosts and ghouls after midnight around here.

ede48660-e5b8-49a6-b800-bd92a1974530.name: Oliviavante Potter's Field
ede48660-e5b8-49a6-b800-bd92a1974530.output:
You walk down King Way to the potter's field. It is located at the end of a long tunnel, and is decently sized, with several rows of plots. You enter the potter's field under a small arch made up of the curved branches of several fir trees. It's mostly overgrown with weeds, but the graves themselves are well upkept. As you enter you notice one of the graves is surrounded by a group of mourners.


Gravedigger

A gravedigger is sitting atop a nearby grave eating a pre-made meal.
The gravedigger greets you as you come near, and introduces herself as Eran Warmwater. She says not to bother her too much right now.

32fd84f6-f539-4c52-aa34-0cd2c0974776.name: The Prison of Deephollow
32fd84f6-f539-4c52-aa34-0cd2c0974776.output:
The Prison of Deephollow is deep underground, near the bottom of a deep system of caverns and was built for another purpose originally.
It is known for the quality of its meals, and consists of organized around a large central cell block or pit.
It is rumoured that hidden inside the dungeon is the remnants of a long-lost hero.


Cells

The cells inside the dungeon are so dark it’s difficult to say what condition they are in, and prisoners are kept in cells that accommodate up to four prisoners.


Prisoners of The Prison of Deephollow are treated like dogs; they receive poor quality meals and enough healing to keep them alive. The jailer, Riardon Horineth, is a wizard, who has been promised both living subjects and cadavers for experimentation.

3c3f142b-a4f3-4695-8327-c81f6285ad81.name: The Veil
3c3f142b-a4f3-4695-8327-c81f6285ad81.output:
You make your way down King Way, and enter The Veil a shabby cobblestone garrison with a decently built straw roof. The Veil is known for housing the entire list of laws of the town, codified into stone tablets available for anyone to view in the foyer, signifying that the law is for everyone.

It is run by The Peacemen of Club, who are not exactly known for their professionalism. At the moment, a duo of two people in handcuffs are currently trying to throw each other under the bus.

Policing

Oliviavante is policed by The Peacemen of Club, rather than a separate guard. The guard is quite underfunded, and their equipment is always in disrepair. Their officers are held accountable for their actions only when public pressure calls for it, though The Peacemen of Club does not have the funding to perform any training exercises.
One can recognise a member of The Peacemen of Club by the forest green and white livery adorned with an image of a shield.


Law in Oliviavante

Law in Oliviavante is punitive based, and those that breach the laws can expect hard labor, incarceration, fines, or, in some instances, public execution. Crime is an ugly stain on humanity, to be removed wherever possible.

Chief's Office

The person in charge is Berrian Galanodel, a foolish light skinned bony elf. This is a small, but very well funded office. There are rows of weapons, armour, and other peace-keeping related items lining the walls, and there's a rather nice oak table in the centre of the room. It almost gives off the vibe of a boy's clubhouse.

Evidence Locker

 The guardhouse is somewhat messy, with the worst of it concentrated in the cells, which are in need of a deep clean.

Holding Cell
People Around

b79315aa-925d-4940-b47c-b99264264a8d.name: The New Command Post
b79315aa-925d-4940-b47c-b99264264a8d.output:
You make your way down Smith Road, and enter The New Command Post a shabby cobblestone building with a decently built thatched roof. The New Command Post is known for housing the entire list of laws of the town, codified into stone tablets available for anyone to view in the foyer, signifying that the law is for everyone.

It is run by The Peacemen of Club, who are professional. At the moment, a noble is arguing about some fine which was levied against them- they clearly don't think that it's fair.

Policing

Oliviavante is policed by The Peacemen of Club, rather than a separate guard. The guard is quite underfunded, and their equipment is always in disrepair. Their officers are held accountable for their actions only when public pressure calls for it, though The Peacemen of Club does not have the funding to perform any training exercises.
One can recognise a member of The Peacemen of Club by the forest green and white livery adorned with an image of a shield.


Law in Oliviavante

Law in Oliviavante is punitive based, and those that breach the laws can expect hard labor, incarceration, fines, or, in some instances, public execution. Crime is an ugly stain on humanity, to be removed wherever possible.

Chief's Office

The person in charge is Stacee Tallfellow, a strict quite diminutive halfling. The two rooms of this office are connected by a small doorway. One room seems to mainly be used as a meeting or bookkeeping area. It contains a squat table covered in papers, with several writing implements scattered around. The other room seems to be used for storage, and is stocked with weapons and supplies. Most of the weapons seem to be well-maintained, but there are not a large number of spare weapons. The supplies are useful but limited.

Evidence Locker

 The guardhouse is very tidy. The prisoner cells are in pretty good condition, and quite liveable.

Holding Cell
People Around

9bc8e11b-39da-4604-984e-36e8b8668631.name: The Pointy Metalsmith
9bc8e11b-39da-4604-984e-36e8b8668631.output:
You make your way down Priest Plaza, and enter The Pointy Metalsmith and see that inside, the shabby split log smithery with a thatched roof is large. The smithy is fastidious, with a swept floor and tools stored neatly on the walls. There's a desk in the corner with a piece of parchment showing the current project's measurements, and the materials are neatly stored in bins. Clearly, whatever apprentice has been charged with upkeep of the smithy has taken their job very seriously. You can see that activity in The Pointy Metalsmith is not terribly busy. There is a blacksmith currently playing a card game by himself.

On the bench lies a spear. It's obviously amateurish. Anglo moves around the shop, unsure of himself, betraying his lack of skills.

Blacksmith

The blacksmith stops what he is doing and looks your way while you look around. He introduces himself as Anglo Ford, the proprietor of the smithy, and asks what he can do for you.


Anglo Ford
Anglo looks amused, and while you chat, he moves around the shop, preparing a new project for work. Anglo hates working in The Pointy Metalsmith, and says that the patrons of The Pointy Metalsmith are a bit rude and stuck up.


Buy something

"As you can see, we don't exactly get a lot of custom." Anglo says dryly, seemingly resigned to his bad business.

afd9ff6f-ae72-4866-adcc-0b21440576ee.name: The Peacemen of Club
afd9ff6f-ae72-4866-adcc-0b21440576ee.output:
The Peacemen of Club is a guards watch. It's quite new, and the slightly above average sized faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by politics. They are adjusting to a change in leadership.


Policing

Oliviavante is policed by The Peacemen of Club, rather than a separate guard. The guard is quite underfunded, and their equipment is always in disrepair. Their officers are held accountable for their actions only when public pressure calls for it, though The Peacemen of Club does not have the funding to perform any training exercises.
One can recognise a member of The Peacemen of Club by the forest green and white livery adorned with an image of a shield.


Law in Oliviavante

Law in Oliviavante is punitive based, and those that breach the laws can expect hard labor, incarceration, fines, or, in some instances, public execution. Crime is an ugly stain on humanity, to be removed wherever possible.

Governance


It's ruled by Sam Nimblefingers, who was the most charismatic of the group. He is usually competent, and his position is very stable due to the lack of infighting for the leadership role. Bribes are uncommon, and frowned upon.


Members

Members of The Peacemen of Club are identifiable by following any order given to them. Membership requires referral by an existing member, and costs ten gold pieces. The initiation into The Peacemen of Club involves a secret ritual.




Relationships
Name Race Occupation Relationship
Sam Nimblefingers Halfling Fighter Head of Faction

Resources

They have limitless resources. A handful of favours are jealously guarded, as are a significant number of trade goods, a handful of contacts, a handful of gems, and one or two valuable artifacts.


Politics

The Peacemen of Club have a handful of trusted allies;
A veritable army of wizards and a veritable army of bandits can be called on for aid. The Peacemen of Club have managed to become almost universally disliked; A guild of bandits are rivals. Other enemies include a guild of bandits, a guild of thieves, a guild of thieves, a guild of thieves, and a guild of bandits.

3b2597b9-7348-45d9-90d0-8465940a2072.name: The Oliviavante Men
3b2597b9-7348-45d9-90d0-8465940a2072.output:
The Oliviavante Men is a nobles society. It's very old, and the above average sized faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by money. They are against the current political regime.



Governance


It's ruled by Aemy Gross, who was able to rise to power through nepotism. She is of mild competence, and her position is somewhat unstable due to internal power struggles. Bribes are uncommon, and frowned upon.


Members

Members of The Oliviavante Men are identifiable by their attention to detail. Membership requires an excellent reputation, and costs a hundred gold pieces. The initiation into The Oliviavante Men involves a simple form to be filled.




Relationships
Name Race Occupation Relationship
Aemy Gross Human Blacksmith's assistant Head of Faction

Resources

They have limitless resources. A fair few favours are jealously guarded, as are a significant number of magical weapons, a significant number of trade goods, a significant number of magical trinkets, and a fair few old favours.


Politics

The Oliviavante Men have a considerable number of allies;
A veritable army of thieves will help if called upon, as will a veritable army of fellow nobles, a veritable army of politicians, and a veritable army of monks. The Oliviavante Men have few rivals; A guild of bandits are the enemies of The Oliviavante Men.
